annotation.spannedText: Every person in the state of Mississippi who owns, or has in his or her possession, any dog or cat of the age of three (3) months or over shall have said dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) against rabies

classMention.mentionClass: Every person in the state of Mississippi who owns, or has in his or her possession, any dog or cat of the age of three (3) months or over shall have said dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) against rabies

annotation.spannedText: it shall be unlawful for any person within the state of Mississippi to own or have in his or her possession within the state of Mississippi any dog or cat three (3) months of age or over which has not been inoculated (vaccinated) against rabies with the approved dosage of an approved anti-rabic virus (vaccine)

classMention.mentionClass: it shall be unlawful for any person within the state of Mississippi to own or have in his or her possession within the state of Mississippi any dog or cat three (3) months of age or over which has not been inoculated (vaccinated) against rabies with the approved dosage of an approved anti-rabic virus (vaccine)

annotation.spannedText: It shall be the duty of every person in this state so owning or having in his or her possession a dog or cat to have said dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) immediately after said dog or cat has reached the age of three (3) months

classMention.mentionClass: It shall be the duty of every person in this state so owning or having in his or her possession a dog or cat to have said dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) immediately after said dog or cat has reached the age of three (3) months

annotation.spannedText: it shall be said person’s further duty to have said dog or cat so inoculated (vaccinated) thereafter as required by the state board of health

classMention.mentionClass: it shall be said person’s further duty to have said dog or cat so inoculated (vaccinated) thereafter as required by the state board of health

annotation.spannedText: For a failure to comply with this section said person shall be subject to the penalties provided in Section 41-53-13. 41-53-5

classMention.mentionClass: For a failure to comply with this section said person shall be subject to the penalties provided in Section 41-53-13. 41-53-5

annotation.spannedText: All inoculations (vaccinations) done in accordance with this chapter must be done by either a licensed veterinarian or other competent person granted a permit to administer virus (vaccine) by the State Board of Health

classMention.mentionClass: All inoculations (vaccinations) done in accordance with this chapter must be done by either a licensed veterinarian or other competent person granted a permit to administer virus (vaccine) by the State Board of Health

annotation.spannedText: It shall be the duty of the manufacturer or manufacturers contracted with to furnish virus (vaccine) to furnish with each ampoule (dose) of virus (vaccine), a suitable metal tag approved by the state board of health

classMention.mentionClass: It shall be the duty of the manufacturer or manufacturers contracted with to furnish virus (vaccine) to furnish with each ampoule (dose) of virus (vaccine), a suitable metal tag approved by the state board of health

annotation.spannedText: Said tag shall have stamped thereon the serial number of vaccination and the year in which said dog was inoculated

classMention.mentionClass: Said tag shall have stamped thereon the serial number of vaccination and the year in which said dog was inoculated

annotation.spannedText: This tag shall be furnished to the owner when said dog is inoculated (vaccinated), and it shall be his duty to securely attach same to the collar, and each dog owned by or in the possession of any person within the state of Mississippi shall wear at all times a collar or other device which shall have securely bradded on to it the metal tag provided for above

classMention.mentionClass: This tag shall be furnished to the owner when said dog is inoculated (vaccinated), and it shall be his duty to securely attach same to the collar, and each dog owned by or in the possession of any person within the state of Mississippi shall wear at all times a collar or other device which shall have securely bradded on to it the metal tag provided for above

annotation.spannedText: Any such tag shall not be transferable to any dog other than the dog for which it was issued

classMention.mentionClass: Any such tag shall not be transferable to any dog other than the dog for which it was issued

annotation.spannedText: All persons administering virus (vaccine) in accordance with this chapter shall furnish the owner of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) a certificate of inoculation (vaccination) for each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) indicating the breed of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), the sex of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), and the markings and the serial number of the tag attached to the collar or some other device on each dog

classMention.mentionClass: All persons administering virus (vaccine) in accordance with this chapter shall furnish the owner of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) a certificate of inoculation (vaccination) for each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated) indicating the breed of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), the sex of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), and the markings and the serial number of the tag attached to the collar or some other device on each dog

annotation.spannedText: Persons administering virus (vaccine) in accordance with this chapter shall maintain records of each inoculation, indicating the owner of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), the breed of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), the sex of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated ), and the markings and serial number of the tag furnished to the owner of each dog

classMention.mentionClass: Persons administering virus (vaccine) in accordance with this chapter shall maintain records of each inoculation, indicating the owner of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), the breed of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated), the sex of each dog or cat inoculated (vaccinated ), and the markings and serial number of the tag furnished to the owner of each dog

annotation.spannedText: It shall be lawful and it shall be their duty for any sheriff, conservation officer or peace officer of a county or municipality to kill any dog above the age of three (3) months found running at large on whose neck there is no such collar and tag

classMention.mentionClass: It shall be lawful and it shall be their duty for any sheriff, conservation officer or peace officer of a county or municipality to kill any dog above the age of three (3) months found running at large on whose neck there is no such collar and tag

annotation.spannedText: No action shall be maintained by the owner for such killing

classMention.mentionClass: No action shall be maintained by the owner for such killing

annotation.spannedText: it shall be the duty of said officer who finds a dog or dogs running at large to first keep said dog or dogs for a period of five (5) days and notify the sheriff of said county that he has said dog or dogs, giving the sheriff a description of same

classMention.mentionClass: it shall be the duty of said officer who finds a dog or dogs running at large to first keep said dog or dogs for a period of five (5) days and notify the sheriff of said county that he has said dog or dogs, giving the sheriff a description of same

annotation.spannedText: If anyone proves himself to be the owner of same, he shall pay said officer the sum of fifty cents (50¢) before the dog is delivered to the owner

classMention.mentionClass: If anyone proves himself to be the owner of same, he shall pay said officer the sum of fifty cents (50¢) before the dog is delivered to the owner

annotation.spannedText: It shall be the duty of any sheriff, conservation officer or peace officer of a county or municipality to kill or otherwise destroy any and all dogs above the age of three (3) months which are running at large and have not been inoculated (vaccinated) as required in this chapter

classMention.mentionClass: It shall be the duty of any sheriff, conservation officer or peace officer of a county or municipality to kill or otherwise destroy any and all dogs above the age of three (3) months which are running at large and have not been inoculated (vaccinated) as required in this chapter

annotation.spannedText: the offender shall, on conviction thereof, be fined for the first offense in a sum not to exceed five dollars ($5.00) and for the second offense in a sum not to exceed twenty-five dollars ($25.00) and for the third offense a sum not to exceed fifty dollars ($50.00), together with all costs

classMention.mentionClass: the offender shall, on conviction thereof, be fined for the first offense in a sum not to exceed five dollars ($5.00) and for the second offense in a sum not to exceed twenty-five dollars ($25.00) and for the third offense a sum not to exceed fifty dollars ($50.00), together with all costs

annotation.spannedText: It shall be the duty of the sheriffs, conservation officers and all peace officers of the counties and municipalities of Mississippi to enforce this chapter

classMention.mentionClass: It shall be the duty of the sheriffs, conservation officers and all peace officers of the counties and municipalities of Mississippi to enforce this chapter

annotation.spannedText: It shall be the duty of the county attorneys and district attorneys of this state to prosecute all violators of this chapter

classMention.mentionClass: It shall be the duty of the county attorneys and district attorneys of this state to prosecute all violators of this chapter

annotation.spannedText: The following measures shall be used to control or prevent the included diseases of public health importance

classMention.mentionClass: The following measures shall be used to control or prevent the included diseases of public health importance

annotation.spannedText: Class 1 diseases are of major public health importance which shall be reported directly to the State Department of Health by telephone within 24 hours of first knowledge or suspicion

classMention.mentionClass: Class 1 diseases are of major public health importance which shall be reported directly to the State Department of Health by telephone within 24 hours of first knowledge or suspicion

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines selected for immunizing dogs and cats shall be licensed as providing 3-year immunity

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines selected for immunizing dogs and cats shall be licensed as providing 3-year immunity

annotation.spannedText: All dogs and cats shall be vaccinated against rabies at three months of age, revaccinated one year later and every three years thereafter, using a rabies vaccine approved as providing a 3-year immunity

classMention.mentionClass: All dogs and cats shall be vaccinated against rabies at three months of age, revaccinated one year later and every three years thereafter, using a rabies vaccine approved as providing a 3-year immunity

annotation.spannedText: Unvaccinated dogs, cats, and ferrets exposed to a rabid animal should be euthanized immediately

classMention.mentionClass: Unvaccinated dogs, cats, and ferrets exposed to a rabid animal should be euthanized immediately

annotation.spannedText: If the owner is unwilling to have this done, the animal should be placed in strict isolation for 6 months and vaccinated 1 month before being released

classMention.mentionClass: If the owner is unwilling to have this done, the animal should be placed in strict isolation for 6 months and vaccinated 1 month before being released

annotation.spannedText: Animals with expired vaccinations need to be evaluated on a case-by-case basis

classMention.mentionClass: Animals with expired vaccinations need to be evaluated on a case-by-case basis

annotation.spannedText: Dogs, cats, and ferrets that are currently vaccinated should be revaccinated immediately, kept under the owner’s control, and observed for 45 days

classMention.mentionClass: Dogs, cats, and ferrets that are currently vaccinated should be revaccinated immediately, kept under the owner’s control, and observed for 45 days

annotation.spannedText: A healthy dog, cat or ferret that bites a person shall be confined and observed for 10 days in a manner acceptable to the local health officer or his or her designee

classMention.mentionClass: A healthy dog, cat or ferret that bites a person shall be confined and observed for 10 days in a manner acceptable to the local health officer or his or her designee

annotation.spannedText: Rabies vaccine shall not be administered during the observation period

classMention.mentionClass: Rabies vaccine shall not be administered during the observation period

annotation.spannedText: Such animals shall be evaluated by a veterinarian at the first sign of illness during confinement

classMention.mentionClass: Such animals shall be evaluated by a veterinarian at the first sign of illness during confinement

annotation.spannedText: Any illness in the animal shall be reported immediately to the local health department

classMention.mentionClass: Any illness in the animal shall be reported immediately to the local health department

annotation.spannedText: If signs suggestive of rabies develop, the animal shall be euthanized, its head removed, and the head shipped under refrigeration to the State Department of Health Laboratory for examination

classMention.mentionClass: If signs suggestive of rabies develop, the animal shall be euthanized, its head removed, and the head shipped under refrigeration to the State Department of Health Laboratory for examination

annotation.spannedText: Animals other than dogs, cats, or ferrets that might have exposed a person to rabies should be reported immediately to the health department

classMention.mentionClass: Animals other than dogs, cats, or ferrets that might have exposed a person to rabies should be reported immediately to the health department

annotation.spannedText: The need for euthanizing and testing the animal shall be decided upon consultation with the Division of Epidemiology

classMention.mentionClass: The need for euthanizing and testing the animal shall be decided upon consultation with the Division of Epidemiology

annotation.spannedText: Post-exposure management of persons should follow the recommendations of the ACIP

classMention.mentionClass: Post-exposure management of persons should follow the recommendations of the ACIP

annotation.spannedText: All dogs three (3) months of age and older transported or moved into the state for any purpose shall be accompanied by an official health certificate with the following compliance

classMention.mentionClass: All dogs three (3) months of age and older transported or moved into the state for any purpose shall be accompanied by an official health certificate with the following compliance

annotation.spannedText: All cats three (3) months of age and older transported or moved into the state for any purpose shall be accompanied by an official health certificate with the following compliance

classMention.mentionClass: All cats three (3) months of age and older transported or moved into the state for any purpose shall be accompanied by an official health certificate with the following compliance
